overview: eBuddy is a web-based messenger service that allows you to chat with your MSN, Yahoo and AIM contacts on one page. They also have a mobile browser for accessing your contacts on your mobile. eBuddy doesn’t require any downloads, so you can easily get to your contacts on other computers.

milestones.description: eBuddy Processing 1 billion Messages per Month for 2M Unique Mobile Users
milestones.source_text:
eBuddy, the world's leading independent provider of web and mobile messaging (IM), announced today that it has surpassed 5M downloads of its mobile IM client in its first year. The company is now processing over 1 billion messages per month on its mobile platform and counts more than 2 million unique monthly mobile users. eBuddy also announced updated releases and redesiged user interfaces for both of their popular mobile IM clients.
ADVERTISEMENT

San Francisco, CA (PRWEB) July 25, 2008 -- eBuddy, the world's leading independent provider of web and mobile instant messaging (IM), announced today that it has experienced explosive mobile IM growth, surpassing 5 million downloads of its mobile IM client since its launch in June 2007.

Jan-Joost Rueb, eBuddy CEO and founder commented, "We are now processing over 1 billion messages per month on our mobile platform for more than 2 million unique monthly users. The fast pace at which our application is being picked up shows how much people want a high quality, easy-to-use, intuitive IM application like eBuddy."

eBuddy also announced updated releases for both of its mobile clients, the popular J2ME client and the mobile Internet browser version, Lite Messenger. The latest J2ME release features a redesigned and improved user interface and the addition of the eBuddy ID (which already exists on eBuddy's web browser version) and allows the user to create a single, unique ID which can then be used to log-in and access all of their IM accounts simultaneously. The latest Lite Messenger release includes new features, extra networks and specific design functionality for iPhone, including the new 3G version released worldwide on July 11.

Research analysts at Informa estimate the global market for mobile IM will become an $11 billion (â‚¬7.4bn) industry by 2011. eBuddy's VP of Mobile, Jan-Joost Kraal adds, "eBuddy has become one of the most downloaded mobile applications worldwide within a year due to rapid adoption, ramped up channel distribution and the help of partners like GetJar. Mobile Internet usage on a global scale is only going to increase, and with a single user average of 30 log-ins per month, eBuddy is an excellent reason for customers to buy a flat-fee data bundle from their mobile carrier."

About eBuddy
eBuddy created the world's first, independent, web browser-based instant messaging service in 2003. Its patent-pending technology enables 16M+ monthly global visitors with AIM, GoogleTalk, MSN, MySpace and Yahoo! IM accounts to chat free of charge in one, aggregated interface without having to download or install any application on their computer. Supporting 550+ different mobile devices, eBuddy's mobile IM solution - m.ebuddy.com -- offers both a J2ME and browser-based IM service and allows 2M+ unique monthly user's access on their mobile phone, independent of carrier or device via WAP or mobile Internet browser. eBuddy is a privately held, Amsterdam-based company with additional offices in London and San Francisco, and is backed by Prime Technology Ventures and Lowland Capital Partners.
milestones.source_description: Hungry mobile IM users consume 5M downloads in first year eBuddy processing 1 billion messages per month for 2M unique mobile users

milestones.description: Former Google Executive, Marc Duijndam Joins eBuddy
milestones.source_text:
eBuddy taps former Google executive, Marc Duijndam to work collaboratively with the company's senior management team to accelerate worldwide sales growth and strategic channel development.
ADVERTISEMENT

Amsterdam, The Netherlands (PRWEB) August 21, 2008 -- eBuddy, the world's leading independent provider of web and mobile instant messaging (IM), today announced that it has tapped former Google Netherlands executive, Marc Duijndam, to join eBuddy in a highly strategic support role where he will work collaboratively with the company's senior management team and will focus specifically on accelerating worldwide sales and channel development for eBuddy.

Mr. Duijndam brings a wealth of Internet and technology experience having previously worked nearly 6 years for Google. He joined Google in 2002 as Country Manager, Benelux where he was the first employee hired, and served as Country Director, Netherlands in his most recent role. Prior to joining Google, he worked as a sales manager for Ilse Media, the largest Internet publisher in the Netherlands.

Jan-Joost Rueb, CEO and founder of eBuddy states: "Marc's proven track record of successful leadership in growing internet businesses is extremely relevant to eBuddy, and we are delighted to have him on board. This appointment is a key part of the team we are building to drive the next stage of our development, demonstrating our commitment to accelerating our growth on a worldwide scale."

Commenting on the new appointment, Mr. Duijndam adds: "I believe there is enormous potential to extend the eBuddy brand into new partnerships, markets and geographies, and I'm delighted to be working with a strong management team that is as passionate about growth as I am. I look forward to lending strategic vision and support to ensure we are meeting our global customers needs whilst building upon our enviable reputation as one of Europe's fastest growing private companies."

About eBuddy
eBuddy created the world's first, independent, web browser-based instant messaging service. Its patent-pending technology enables 16M monthly global visitors with AIM, GoogleTalk, MSN, MySpace and Yahoo! IM accounts to chat free of charge in one, aggregated interface-no downloads required! eBuddy's mobile IM client offers both a J2ME and browser-based IM service and allows 2M unique monthly user's access on their mobile phone, independent of carrier or device via WAP or mobile Internet browser. eBuddy is headquartered in Amsterdam with satellite offices in London and San Francisco, and is a privately-held company backed by Prime Technology Ventures and Lowland Capital Partners.
